name: bushfire
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a fire burning in the bush (= a wild area of land) that is difficult to control and sometimes spreads quickly: Eight people died as bushfires swept southern Australia.
mack2happy/E+/GettyImages
something that spreads very quickly and is difficult to control, and usually causes a lot of damage: The court's ruling was a spark that started a bush fire.
More examplesFewer examplesToday has been horrifically hot, there's a bushfire very close and the whole city smells of burning.A tourist appeared in court accused of starting a bush fire with a cigarette.Since his confession, the scandal has spread like a bushfire through the party. There is a growing list of banks burnt out by the wild bushfire of the global liquidity crisis.
